TopicTitle: kerbal space program is now supported by nvidia geforce experience

Articles.Content:
I just discovered this morning that kerbal space program has been added to the geforce experience.

To be noted that it might not be a recent addition (It's not something I check everyday).

But still, kerbal space program is now playing in the field with the big boys ! Congratulations !
I still wait for the day when Nvidia will team up with Squad to make ksp more realistic. (in both way,physic and graphic.)
Wow, that's very interesting! I agree, I wonder when it was added?
What benefit can be had from this? I've never really used the nvidia software... I mean it runs in the background but I've never used it for much.

For games it supports, it autoconfigures the graphical settings of the game to look the best on your video card. I used it for Sleeping Dogs and it didn't make my computer blow up but I didn't notice a difference.

I'll try it for KSP. Why not?

I've tried Geforce Experience on a few games (Arkham Asylum being one of them) and I haven't noticed a particular benefit from using it versus the in game rendering options. Unless you want a one click button of course.

I've tried Geforce Experience on a few games (Arkham Asylum being one of them) and I haven't noticed a particular benefit from using it versus the in game rendering options. Unless you want a one click button of course.

That's generally the idea. A lot of gamers don't have a clue/don't care about specifics; they just bought the PC in the shop or online, and wan't to get straight to gaming.

I found out that one of my parameters in G.E was not already set. Something like "texture rÃƒÂ©duction" (don't have the name here at work) that is now set to 1:1

Is it something new ? or outside of KSP ? or just an after effect of me palying with the properties files.

It told me to turn some stuff up (shadows and fallback shaders), and to play full screen. I let it make all those settings except the full screen one, as I run it -popupwindow because that plays better with FRAPS and doesn't freak out with all the alt-tabbing I do.
